--log-priority=value --log-priority=value
Set the internal log level of udevd. Valid values are the numeri cal syslog priorities or their textual representations: err, info and debug . Set the internal log level of udevd. Valid values are the numeri cal syslog priorities or their textual representations: err, info and debug .
--stop-exec-queue --stop-exec-queue
Signal udevd to stop executing new events. Incoming events will be queued. Signal udevd to stop executing new events. Incoming events will be queued.
--start-exec-queue --start-exec-queue
Signal udevd to enable the execution of events. Signal udevd to enable the execution of events.

--children-max=value --children-max=value
Set the maximum number of events, udevd will handle at the same time. Set the maximum number of events, udevd will handle at the same time.

udevadm monitor [options] udevadm monitor [options]
Listens to the kernel uevents and events sent out by a udev rule and prints the devpath of the event to the console. It can be used to analyze the event timing, by comparing the timestamps of the kernel uevent and the udev Listens to the kernel uevents and events sent out by a udev rule and prints the devpath of the event to the console.
